identityMetadata.objectLabel: Latin glossary : small manuscript fragment on vellum.

use.human: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Special Collections Public Services Librarian at speccollref@stanford.edu.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Latin glossary : small manuscript fragment on vellum
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Unidentified Latin vocabulary, this portion part of the letter M, with a total of 35 lemmata (a word or phrase that is glossed; headword).
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Open for research; material must be requested at least 24 hours in advance of intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lower portion of vellum leaf, removed from a binding.
Script: professional gotica textualis, 2 columns, with a fair amount of abbreviations.
Previously in the Bernard M. Rosenthal collection; with Rosenthal's dealer description included with the manuscript, together with a note re previous ownership of Bernard Bischoff.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Manuscripts, Latin (Medieval and modern)
Manuscripts, Latin (Medieval and modern)--France
